poem:
Title: An Unrivaled River's End

On Chelsea Bridge,
suspicion drowned,
By dark Thames edge,
no body found.

Lament not for the unfound,
who left a woman, wounded, weeping.
Capitulating to the sound,
of cruel currents, secrets keeping.

No man in sight,
since winter's day,
Yet not in flight,
in water's sway.

A life, now missed
in cradled river's nest,
'neath London's mist,
finds its silent rest.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Chemical attack suspect Abdul Ezedi probably dead, police say Police hunting the Clapham chemical attack suspect, Abdul Ezedi, say they believe he is dead after going into the River Thames at Chelsea Bridge four hours after he left a woman severely injured. Scotland Yard said Ezedi’s body had not been found but he was last seen close to the River Thames. Officers had been looking for the 35-year-old since Wednesday 31 January when he was". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
